conclusion: Determine if the puppy is safe by analyzing the velocity-time graph and calculating distance traveled.
Velocity-time graph shows constant velocity at 20 m/s from t = 0 to t = 0.5 s, then velocity decreases uniformly.
Bus travels at 20 m/s for the first 0.5 s.
At t = 0.5 s, the bus starts decelerating.
Use v = v_0 - at to find velocity at t = 1 s.
Deceleration a is found from the slope of the line segment from t = 0.5 s to t = 1 s.
Calculate a using slope: (20 - v) / 0.5 = (20 - 15) / 0.5 = 10 m/s².
Calculate distance from t = 0.5 s to t = 1 s using s = v_0t + 1/2at² = 20 × 0.5 + 1/2 × 10 × 0.5² = 11.25 m.
Compare distance to puppy's position at 45 m. The bus will collide with the puppy.
Final conclusion: No, the puppy is not safe.
